oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of conformationally constrained alpha-imino acid derivatives via ring-closing metathesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
KHEDKAR, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: diels-alder reaction
amino-acids
olefin-metathesis
tic derivatives
azetidine-2-carboxylic acid
indolizidine alkaloids
catalysts
isomerization
heterocycles
inhibitors
peptidomemitics
conformationally constrained amino acids
conformationally constrained imino acids
ring-closing metathesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Conformationally constrained amino acid derivatives are useful in the synthesis of peptidomimetics. Seven-, and eight-membered conformationally constrained alpha-imino acid derivatives have been prepared via RCM (ring-closing metathesis). Interestingly, attempts to achieve the synthesis of nine-membered imino acid derivative resulted in the formation of dimeric, 18-membered macrocyclic bis-alpha-imino acid derivative.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INDIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY SECTION B-ORGANIC CHEMISTRY INCLUDING MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY, 46(6), 975-979
